definition[0]: to go to an event such as a meeting or a class
example[1]: Please let us know if you are unable to attend.
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually say go (to) or come (to) instead of attend:
example[2]: I didn’t go to the parents’ meeting.
example[3]: Please let us know if you can’t come.
definition[1]: to go regularly to a school, church etc
example[4]: I am the first child in my family to attend college.
definition[2]: to happen or exist at the same time as something
example[5]: the peculiar atmosphere which attends such an event
definition[3]: to look after someone, especially because they are ill
example[6]: On his deathbed the General was attended by several doctors.
explanation[1]: Attend is often passive in this meaning
definition[4]: to go to an event such as a meeting
example[7]: The two men both attended a 90-minute board meeting yesterday.
